expiry.description: Only Images created automatically (from a deleted Linode; type=automatic) will expire.

eol.description: The date of the image's planned end of life. Some images, like custom private images, will not have an end of life date. In that case this field will be `None`.

vendor.description: The upstream distribution vendor. `None` for private Images.

id.description: The Invoice's unique ID.

label.description: The Invoice's display label.

subtotal.description: The amount of the Invoice before taxes in US Dollars.

tax.description: The amount of tax levied on the Invoice in US Dollars.

total.description: The amount of the Invoice after taxes in US Dollars.

amount.description: The price, in US dollars, of the Invoice Item. Equal to the unit price multiplied by quantity.

tax.description: The amount of tax levied on this Item in US Dollars.

total.description: The price of this Item after taxes in US Dollars.

from.description: The date the Invoice Item started, based on month.

label.description: The Invoice Item's display label.

quantity.description: The quantity of this Item for the specified Invoice.

to.description: The date the Invoice Item ended, based on month.

type.description: The type of service, ether `hourly` or `misc`.

unit_price.description: The monthly service fee in US Dollars for this Item.

IPAddress.description: An IP address that exists in Linode's system, either IPv4 or IPv6.

gateway.description: The default gateway for this address.

subnet_mask.description: The mask that separates host bits from network bits for this address.

prefix.description: The number of bits set in the subnet mask.

type.description: The type of address this is.

public.description: Whether this is a public or private IP address.

rdns.description: The reverse DNS assigned to this address. For public IPv4 addresses, this will be set to a default value provided by Linode if not explicitly set.

linode_id.description: The ID of the Linode this address currently belongs to. For IPv4 addresses, this is by default the Linode that this address was assigned to on creation, and these addresses my be moved using the [/networking/ipv4/assign](/api/v4/networking-ipv-4-assign/#post) endpoint. For SLAAC and link-local addresses, this value may not be changed.

region.description: The Region this IP address resides in.

IPAddressPrivate.description: A private IPv4 address that exists in Linode's system.

gateway.description: The default gateway for this address.

subnet_mask.description: The mask that separates host bits from network bits for this address.

prefix.description: The number of bits set in the subnet mask.

type.description: The type of address this is.

public.description: Whether this is a public or private IP address.

rdns.description: The reverse DNS assigned to this address.

linode_id.description: The ID of the Linode this address currently belongs to.

region.description: The Region this address resides in.

IPAddressV6LinkLocal.description: A link-local IPv6 address that exists in Linode's system,.

gateway.description: The default gateway for this address.

type.description: The type of address this is.

public.description: Whether this is a public or private IP address.

rdns.description: The reverse DNS assigned to this address.

linode_id.description: The ID of the Linode this address currently belongs to.

region.description: The Region this address resides in.

IPAddressV6Slaac.description: A SLAAC IPv6 address that exists in Linode's system.

gateway.description: The default gateway for this address.

type.description: The type of address this is.

public.description: Whether this is a public or private IP address.

rdns.description: The reverse DNS assigned to this address.

linode_id.description: The ID of the Linode this address currently belongs to.

region.description: The Region this address resides in.

IPv6Pool.description: An object representing an IPv6 pool.

range.description: The IPv6 range of addresses in this pool.

prefix.description: The prefix length of the address, denoting how many addresses can be assigned from this pool calculated as 2 <sup>128-prefix</sup>.

region.description: The region for this pool of IPv6 addresses.

route_target.description: The last address in this block of IPv6 addresses.

IPv6Range.description: An object representing an IPv6 range.

range.description: The IPv6 range of addresses in this pool.

prefix.description: The prefix length of the address, denoting how many addresses can be assigned from this range calculated as 2 <sup>128-prefix</sup>.

region.description: The region for this range of IPv6 addresses.

route_target.description: The last address in this block of IPv6 addresses.

id.description: The unique ID of this Kernel.

label.description: The friendly name of this Kernel.

kvm.description: If this Kernel is suitable for KVM Linodes.

xen.description: If this Kernel is suitable for Xen Linodes.

pvops.description: If this Kernel is suitable for paravirtualized operations.

deprecated.description: If this Kernel is marked as deprecated, this field has a value of true; otherwise, this field is false.

label.description:
The Linode's label is for display purposes only. If no label is provided for a Linode, a default will be assigned.
Linode labels have the following constraints:

  * Must start with an alpha character.
  * May only consist of alphanumeric characters, dashes (`-`), underscores (`_`) or periods (`.`).
  * Cannot have two dashes (`--`), underscores (`__`) or periods (`..`) in a row.

region.description: This is the location where the Linode was deployed. A Linode's region can only be changed by initiating a [cross data center migration](/api/v4/linode-instances-linode-id-migrate/#post).

type.description:
This is the [Linode Type](/api/v4/linode-types) that this Linode was deployed with.
To change a Linode's Type, use [POST /linode/instances/{linodeId}/resize](/api/v4/linode-instances-linode-id-resize/#post).

group.description: A deprecated property denoting a group label for this Linode.

tags.description: An array of tags applied to this object.  Tags are for organizational purposes only.

id.description: This Linode's ID which must be provided for all operations impacting this Linode.

status.description: A brief description of this Linode's current state. This field may change without direct action from you. For example, when a Linode goes into maintenance mode its status will display "stopped".

hypervisor.description: The virtualization software powering this Linode.

created.description: When this Linode was created.

updated.description: When this Linode was last updated.

ipv4.description:
This Linode's IPv4 Addresses. Each Linode is assigned a single public IPv4 address
upon creation, and may get a single private IPv4 address if needed. You may need to
[open a support ticket](/api/v4/support-tickets/#post)
to get additional IPv4 addresses.

IPv4 addresses may be reassigned between your Linodes, or shared with other Linodes.
See the [/networking](#tag/networking) endpoints for details.

ipv6.description: This Linode's IPv6 SLAAC addresses. This address is specific to a Linode, and may not be shared. If the Linode has not been assigned an IPv6 address, the return value will be `null`.

specs.description: Information about the resources available to this Linode.

disk.description: The amount of storage space, in MB, this Linode has access to. A typical Linode will divide this space between a primary disk with an `image` deployed to it, and a swap disk, usually 512 MB. This is the default configuration created when deploying a Linode with an `image` through [POST /linode/instances](/api/v4/linode-instances/#post). While this configuration is suitable for 99% of use cases, if you need finer control over your Linode's disks, see the [/linode/instances/{linodeId}/disks](/api/v4/linode-instances-linode-id-disks) endpoints.

memory.description: The amount of RAM, in MB, this Linode has access to. Typically a Linode will choose to boot with all of its available RAM, but this can be configured in a Config profile, see the [/linode/instances/{linodeId}/configs](/api/v4/linode-instances-linode-id-configs) endpoints and the LinodeConfig object for more information.

vcpus.description: The number of vcpus this Linode has access to. Typically a Linode will choose to boot with all of its available vcpus, but this can be configured in a Config Profile, see the [/linode/instances/{linodeId}/configs](/api/v4/linode-instances-linode-id-configs) endpoints and the LinodeConfig object for more information.

transfer.description: The amount of network transfer this Linode is allotted each month.

cpu.description:
The percentage of CPU usage required to trigger an alert.
If the average CPU usage over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert.
Your Linode's total CPU capacity is represented as 100%, multiplied by its number of
cores.

For example, a two core Linode's CPU capacity is represented as 200%. If you want
to be alerted at 90% of a two core Linode's CPU capacity, set the alert value to `180`.

The default value is 90% multiplied by the number of cores.

If the value is set to `0` (zero), the alert is disabled.

network_in.description: The amount of incoming traffic, in Mbit/s, required to trigger an alert. If the average incoming traffic over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to `0` (zero), the alert is disabled.

network_out.description: The amount of outbound traffic, in Mbit/s, required to trigger an alert. If the average outbound traffic over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to `0` (zero), the alert is disabled.

transfer_quota.description: The percentage of network transfer that may be used before an alert is triggered. When this value is exceeded, we'll alert you. If this is set to `0` (zero), the alert is disabled.

io.description: The amount of disk IO operation per second required to trigger an alert. If the average disk IO over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If set to `0` (zero), this alert is disabled.

backups.description: Information about this Linode's backups status. For information about available backups, see [/linode/instances/{linodeId}/backups](/api/v4/linode-instances-linode-id-backups).

enabled.description: If this Linode has the Backup service enabled. To enable backups, see [POST /linode/instances/{linodeId}/backups/enable](/api/v4/linode-instances-linode-id-backups-enable/#post).

day.description:
The day of the week that your Linode's weekly Backup is taken.
If not set manually, a day will be chosen for you. Backups
are taken every day, but backups taken on this day are
preferred when selecting backups to retain for a longer period.


If not set manually, then when backups are initially enabled, this
may come back as `Scheduling` until the `day` is automatically selected.

window.description:
The window in which your backups will be taken, in UTC. A
backups window is a two-hour span of time in which the backup
may occur.


For example, `W10` indicates that your backups should be
taken between 10:00 and 12:00. If you do not choose a backup
window, one will be selected for you automatically.


If not set manually, when backups are initially enabled this
may come back as `Scheduling` until the `window` is automatically selected.

last_successful.description: The last successful backup date. 'null' if there was no previous backup.

watchdog_enabled.description:
The watchdog, named Lassie, is a Shutdown Watchdog that monitors your Linode and will reboot it if it powers off unexpectedly. It works by issuing a boot job when your Linode powers off without a shutdown job being responsible.
To prevent a loop, Lassie will give up if there have been more than 5 boot jobs issued within 15 minutes.

LinodeBase.description: Common properties for Linode Request and Response objects.

label.description:
The Linode's label is for display purposes only. If no label is provided for a Linode, a default will be assigned.
Linode labels have the following constraints:

  * Must begin and end with an alphanumeric character.
  * May only consist of alphanumeric characters, dashes (`-`), underscores (`_`) or periods (`.`).
  * Cannot have two dashes (`--`), underscores (`__`) or periods (`..`) in a row.

group.description: A deprecated property denoting a group label for this Linode.

id.description: The ID of this Config.

kernel.description: A Kernel ID to boot a Linode with. Defaults to "linode/latest-64bit".

comments.description: Optional field for arbitrary User comments on this Config.

memory_limit.description: Defaults to the total RAM of the Linode.

run_level.description: Defines the state of your Linode after booting. Defaults to `default`.

virt_mode.description:
Controls the virtualization mode. Defaults to `paravirt`.
* `paravirt` is suitable for most cases. Linodes running in paravirt mode
  share some qualities with the host, ultimately making it run faster since
  there is less transition between it and the host.
* `full_virt` affords more customization, but is slower because 100% of the VM
  is virtualized.

helpers.description: Helpers enabled when booting to this Linode Config.

updatedb_disabled.description: Disables updatedb cron job to avoid disk thrashing.

distro.description: Helps maintain correct inittab/upstart console device.

modules_dep.description: Creates a modules dependency file for the Kernel you run.

devtmpfs_automount.description: Populates the /dev directory early during boot without udev.  Defaults to false.

label.description: The Config's label is for display purposes only.

root_device.description:
The root device to boot.
* If no value or an invalid value is provided, root device will default to `/dev/sda`.
* If the device specified at the root device location is not mounted, the Linode will not boot until a device is mounted.

LinodeRequest.description: Common properties for creating and rebuilding Linodes.

booted.description:
This field defaults to `true` if the Linode is created with an Image or from a Backup.
If it is deployed from an Image or a Backup and you wish it to remain `offline` after deployment, set this to `false`.

LinodeStats.description: CPU, IO, IPv4, and IPv6 statistics. Graph data, if available, is in "[timestamp, reading]" array format. Timestamp is a UNIX timestamp in EST.

in.description: Input stats for IPv4, measured in bits/s (bits/second).

out.description: Output stats for IPv4, measured in bits/s (bits/second).

private_in.description: Private IPv4 input statistics, measured in bits/s (bits/second).

private_out.description: Private IPv4 output statistics, measured in bits/s (bits/second).

in.description: Input stats for IPv6, measured in bits/s (bits/second).

out.description: Output stats for IPv6, measured in bits/s (bits/second).

private_in.description: Private IPv6 input statistics, measured in bits/s (bits/second).

private_out.description: Private IPv6 output statistics, measured in bits/s (bits/second).

title.description: The title for this data set.

LinodeType.description: Returns collection of Linode types, including pricing and specifications for each type. These are used when [creating](/api/v4/linode-instances/#post) or [resizing](/api/v4/linode-instances-linode-id-resize/#post) Linodes.

id.description: The ID representing the Linode Type.

label.description: The Linode Type's label is for display purposes only.

disk.description: The Disk size, in MB, of the Linode Type.

class.description:
The class of the Linode Type. We currently offer five classes of Linodes:

  * nanode - Nanode instances are good for low-duty workloads,
    where performance isn't critical. **Note:** As of June 16th, 2020, Nanodes became
    1 GB Linodes in the Cloud Manager, however, the API, the CLI, and billing will
    continue to refer to these instances as Nanodes.
  * standard - Standard Shared instances are good for medium-duty workloads and
    are a good mix of performance, resources, and price. **Note:** As of June 16th, 2020,
    Standard Linodes in the Cloud Manager became Shared Linodes, however, the API, the CLI, and
    billing will continue to refer to these instances as Standard Linodes.
  * dedicated - Dedicated CPU instances are good for full-duty workloads
    where consistent performance is important.
  * gpu - Linodes with dedicated NVIDIA Quadro ® RTX 6000 GPUs accelerate highly
    specialized applications such as machine learning, AI, and video transcoding.
  * highmem - High Memory instances favor RAM over other resources, and can be
    good for memory hungry use cases like caching and in-memory databases.
    All High Memory plans contain dedicated CPU cores.

price.description: Cost in US dollars, broken down into hourly and monthly charges.

addons.description: A list of optional add-on services for Linodes and their associated costs.

backups.description: Information about the optional Backup service offered for Linodes.

price.description: Cost of enabling Backups for this Linode Type.

hourly.description: The cost (in US dollars) per hour to add Backups service.

monthly.description: The cost (in US dollars) per month to add Backups service.

memory.description: Amount of RAM included in this Linode Type.

successor.description: The Linode Type that a [mutate](/api/v4/linode-instances-linode-id-mutate/#post) will upgrade to for a Linode of this type.  If "null", a Linode of this type may not mutate.

transfer.description: The monthly outbound transfer amount, in MB.

vcpus.description: The number of VCPU cores this Linode Type offers.

gpus.description: The number of GPUs this Linode Type offers.

id.description: This Kubernetes cluster's unique ID.

created.description: When this Kubernetes cluster was created.

updated.description: When this Kubernetes cluster was updated.

label.description:
This Kubernetes cluster's unique label for display purposes only.
Labels have the following constraints:

  * UTF-8 characters will be returned by the API using escape
    sequences of their Unicode code points. For example, the
    Japanese character ** is 3 bytes in UTF-8 (`0xE382AB`). Its
    Unicode code point is 2 bytes (`0x30AB`). APIv4 supports this
    character and the API will return it as the escape sequence
    using six 1 byte characters which represent 2 bytes of Unicode
    code point (`"\u30ab"`).
  * 4 byte UTF-8 characters are not supported.
  * If the label is entirely composed of UTF-8 characters, the API
    response will return the code points using up to 193 1 byte
    characters.

k8s_version.description: The desired Kubernetes version for this Kubernetes cluster in the format of <major>.<minor>, and the latest supported patch version will be deployed.

tags.description: An array of tags applied to the Kubernetes cluster. Tags are for organizational purposes only.

LKENodePoolRequestBody.description: Specifies a collection of Linodes which will be members of a Kubernetes cluster.

type.description: A Linode Type for all of the nodes in the Node Pool.

count.description: The number of nodes in the Node Pool.

disks.description:
**Note**: This field should be omitted except for special use cases. The disks specified here are partitions in *addition* to the primary partition and reduce the size of the primary partition, which can lead to stability problems for the Node.

This Node Pool's custom disk layout. Each item in this array will create a new disk partition for each node in this Node Pool.

  * The custom disk layout is applied to each node in this Node Pool.
  * The maximum number of custom disk partitions that can be configured is 7.
  * Once the requested disk paritions are allocated, the remaining disk space is allocated to the node's boot disk.
  * A Node Pool's custom disk layout is immutable over the lifetime of the Node Pool.

items.description: The values to assign to each partition in this Node Pool's custom disk layout.

size.description:
The size of this custom disk partition in MB.

  * The size of this disk partition must not exceed the capacity of the node's plan type.

type.description: This custom disk partition's filesystem type.

LKENodePool.description: The set of Node Pools which are members of the Kubernetes cluster. Node Pools consist of a Linode type, the number of Linodes to deploy of that type, and additional status information.

id.description: This Node Pool's unique ID.

nodes.description: Status information for the Nodes which are members of this Node Pool. If a Linode has not been provisioned for a given Node slot, the instance_id will be returned as null.

LKENodeStatus.description: Status information for a Node which is a member of a Kubernetes cluster.

id.description: The Node's ID.

instance_id.description: The Linode's ID. When no Linode is currently provisioned for this Node, this will be null.

status.description: The Node's status as it pertains to being a Kubernetes node.

id.description: A Kubernetes version number available for deployment to a Kubernetes cluster in the format of <major>.<minor>, and the latest supported patch version.

LongviewClient.description: A LongviewClient is a single monitor set up to track statistics about one of your servers.

id.description: This Client's unique ID.

label.description: This Client's unique label. This is for display purposes only.

api_key.description: The API key for this Client, used when configuring the Longview Client application on your Linode.

install_code.description: The install code for this Client, used when configuring the Longview Client application on your Linode.

apps.description: The apps this Client is monitoring on your Linode. This is configured when you install the Longview Client application, and is present here for information purposes only.

apache.description: If True, the Apache Longview Client module is monitoring Apache on your server.

nginx.description: If True, the Nginx Longview Client module is monitoring Nginx on your server.

mysql.description: If True, the MySQL Longview Client modules is monitoring MySQL on your server.

created.description: When this Longview Client was created.

updated.description: When this Longview Client was last updated.

Login.description: An object representing a previous successful login for a User.

id.description: The unique ID of this login object.

ip.description: The remote IP address that requested the login.

username.description: The username of the User that was logged into.

restricted.description: True if the User that was logged into was a restricted User, false otherwise.

LongviewSubscription.description: A Longview Subscription represents a tier of Longview service you can subscribe to.

id.description: The unique ID of this Subscription tier.

price.description: Pricing information about this Subscription tier.

hourly.description: The hourly price, in US dollars, for this Subscription tier.

monthly.description: The maximum monthly price in US Dollars for this Subscription tier. You will never be charged more than this amount per month for this subscription.

label.description: A display name for this Subscription tier.

clients_included.description: The number of Longview Clients that may be created with this Subscription tier.

longview_subscription.description:
The subscription ID for a particular Longview plan. A value of `null` corresponds to Longview Free.

You can send a request to the [List Longview Subscriptions](/api/v4/longview-subscriptions/) endpoint to receive the details of each plan.

Maintenance.description: Information about maintenance affecting an entity.

type.description: The type of maintenance.

reason.description: The reason maintenance is being performed.
reason.example: This maintenance will allow us to update the BIOS on the hosts motherboard.

entity.description: The entity being affected by maintenance.

label.description: The label of the entity being affected by maintenance.

id.description: The id of the entity being affected by maintenance.

type.description: The type of entity.

url.description: The API endpoint prefix to use in combination with the entity id to find specific information about the entity.

ManagedContact.description: Information about someone Linode's special forces may contact in case an issue is detected with a manager service.

id.description: This Contact's unique ID.

email.description: The address to email this Contact to alert them of issues.

phone.description: Information about how to reach this Contact by phone.

group.description: A grouping for this Contact. This is for display purposes only.

updated.description: When this Contact was last updated.

ManagedCredential.description: A securely-stored Credential that allows Linode's special forces to access a Managed server to respond to Issues.

id.description: This Credential's unique ID.

label.description: The unique label for this Credential. This is for display purposes only.

last_decrypted.description: The date this Credential was last decrypted by a member of Linode special forces.

ManagedIssue.description: An Issue that was detected with a service Linode is managing.

id.description: This Issue's unique ID.

created.description: When this Issue was created. Issues are created in response to issues detected with Managed Services, so this is also when the Issue was detected.

services.description: An array of Managed Service IDs that were affected by this Issue.

entity.description: The ticket this Managed Issue opened.

id.description: This ticket's ID

type.description: The type of entity this is. In this case, it is always a Ticket.

label.description: The summary for this Ticket.

url.description: The relative URL where you can access this Ticket.

ManagedLinodeSettings.description: Settings for a specific Linode related to Managed Services. There is one ManagedLinodeSettings object for each Linode on your Account.

id.description: The ID of the Linode these Settings are for.

label.description: The label of the Linode these Settings are for.

group.description: The group of the Linode these Settings are for. This is for display purposes only.

ssh.description: The SSH settings for this Linode.

access.description: If true, Linode special forces may access this Linode over ssh to respond to Issues.

user.description: The user Linode's special forces should use when accessing this Linode to respond to an issue.

ip.description: The IP Linode special forces should use to access this Linode when responding to an Issue.

port.description: The port Linode special forces should use to access this Linode over ssh to respond to an Issue.

ManagedService.description: A service that Linode is monitoring as part of your Managed services. If issues are detected with this service, a ManagedIssue will be opened and, optionally, Linode special forces will attempt to resolve the Issue.

id.description: This Service's unique ID.

status.description: The current status of this Service.

label.description: The label for this Service. This is for display purposes only.

address.description: The URL at which this Service is monitored.

timeout.description: How long to wait, in seconds, for a response before considering the Service to be down.

body.description: What to expect to find in the response body for the Service to be considered up.

consultation_group.description: The group of ManagedContacts who should be notified or consulted with when an Issue is detected.

notes.description: Any information relevant to the Service that Linode special forces should know when attempting to resolve Issues.

region.description: The Region in which this Service is located. This is required if address is a private IP, and may not be set otherwise.

credentials.description: An array of ManagedCredential IDs that should be used when attempting to resolve issues with this Service.

created.description: When this Managed Service was created.

updated.description: When this Managed Service was last updated.

NodeBalancer.description: Linode's load balancing solution.  Can handle multiple ports, SSL termination, and any number of backends.  NodeBalancer ports are configured with NodeBalancer Configs, and each config is given one or more NodeBalancer Node that accepts traffic.  The traffic should be routed to the  NodeBalancer's ip address, the NodeBalancer will handle routing individual requests to backends.

id.description: This NodeBalancer's unique ID.

label.description: This NodeBalancer's label. These must be unique on your Account.

region.description: The Region where this NodeBalancer is located. NodeBalancers only support backends in the same Region.

created.description: When this NodeBalancer was created.

updated.description: When this NodeBalancer was last updated.

client_conn_throttle.description: Throttle connections per second.  Set to 0 (zero) to disable throttling.

transfer.description: Information about the amount of transfer this NodeBalancer has had so far this month.

total.description: The total transfer, in MB, used by this NodeBalancer this month.

out.description: The total inbound transfer, in MB, used for this NodeBalancer this month.

in.description: The total outbound transfer, in MB, used for this NodeBalancer this month.

tags.description: An array of Tags applied to this object.  Tags are for organizational purposes only.

NodeBalancerConfig.description:
A NodeBalancer config represents the configuration of this NodeBalancer on a single port.  For example, a NodeBalancer Config on port 80 would typically represent how this NodeBalancer response to HTTP requests.

NodeBalancer configs have a list of backends, called "nodes," that they forward requests between based on their configuration.

id.description: This config's unique ID

port.description: The port this Config is for. These values must be unique across configs on a single NodeBalancer (you can't have two configs for port 80, for example).  While some ports imply some protocols, no enforcement is done and you may configure your NodeBalancer however is useful to you. For example, while port 443 is generally used for HTTPS, you do not need SSL configured to have a NodeBalancer listening on port 443.

protocol.description:
The protocol this port is configured to serve.
* If using `http` or `tcp` protocol, `ssl_cert` and `ssl_key` are not supported.
* If using `https` protocol, `ssl_cert` and `ssl_key` are required.

algorithm.description: What algorithm this NodeBalancer should use for routing traffic to backends.

stickiness.description:
Controls how session stickiness is handled on this port.
* If set to `none` connections will always be assigned a backend based on the algorithm configured.
* If set to `table` sessions from the same remote address will be routed to the same
  backend.

* For HTTP or HTTPS clients, `http_cookie` allows sessions to be
  routed to the same backend based on a cookie set by the NodeBalancer.

check.description:
The type of check to perform against backends to ensure they are serving requests. This is used to determine if backends are up or down.
* If `none` no check is performed.
* `connection` requires only a connection to the backend to succeed.
* `http` and `http_body` rely on the backend serving HTTP, and that
  the response returned matches what is expected.

check_interval.description: How often, in seconds, to check that backends are up and serving requests.

check_timeout.description: How long, in seconds, to wait for a check attempt before considering it failed.

check_attempts.description: How many times to attempt a check before considering a backend to be down.

check_path.description: The URL path to check on each backend. If the backend does not respond to this request it is considered to be down.

check_body.description: This value must be present in the response body of the check in order for it to pass. If this value is not present in the response body of a check request, the backend is considered to be down.

check_passive.description: If true, any response from this backend with a `5xx` status code will be enough for it to be considered unhealthy and taken out of rotation.

proxy_protocol.description:
ProxyProtocol is a TCP extension that sends initial TCP connection information such as source/destination IPs and ports to backend devices. This information would be lost otherwise. Backend devices must be configured to work with ProxyProtocol if enabled.

* If ommited, or set to `none`, the NodeBalancer doesn't send any auxilary data over TCP connections. This is the default.
* If set to `v1`, the human-readable header format (Version 1) is used.
* If set to `v2`, the binary header format (Version 2) is used.

cipher_suite.description:
What ciphers to use for SSL connections served by this NodeBalancer.

* `legacy` is considered insecure and should only be used if necessary.

nodebalancer_id.description: The ID for the NodeBalancer this config belongs to.

ssl_commonname.description: The read-only common name automatically derived from the SSL certificate assigned to this NodeBalancerConfig. Please refer to this field to verify that the appropriate certificate is assigned to your NodeBalancerConfig.

ssl_fingerprint.description: The read-only fingerprint automatically derived from the SSL certificate assigned to this NodeBalancerConfig. Please refer to this field to verify that the appropriate certificate is assigned to your NodeBalancerConfig.

ssl_cert.description:
The PEM-formatted public SSL certificate (or the combined PEM-formatted SSL
certificate and Certificate Authority chain) that should be served on this
NodeBalancerConfig's port.

The contents of this field will not be shown in any responses that display
the NodeBalancerConfig. Instead, `<REDACTED>` will be printed where the field
appears.

The read-only `ssl_commonname` and `ssl_fingerprint` fields in a NodeBalancerConfig
response are automatically derived from your certificate. Please refer to these fields to
verify that the appropriate certificate was assigned to your NodeBalancerConfig.

ssl_key.description:
The PEM-formatted private key for the SSL certificate set in the `ssl_cert` field.

The contents of this field will not be shown in any responses that display
the NodeBalancerConfig. Instead, `<REDACTED>` will be printed where the field
appears.

The read-only `ssl_commonname` and `ssl_fingerprint` fields in a NodeBalancerConfig
response are automatically derived from your certificate. Please refer to these fields to
verify that the appropriate certificate was assigned to your NodeBalancerConfig.

nodes_status.description: A structure containing information about the health of the backends for this port.  This information is updated periodically as checks are performed against backends.

up.description: The number of backends considered to be "UP" and healthy, and that are serving requests.

down.description: The number of backends considered to be "DOWN" and unhealthy.  These are not in rotation, and not serving requests.

NodeBalancerNode.description: A NodeBalancerNode represents a single backend serving requests for a single port of a NodeBalancer.  Nodes are specific to NodeBalancer Configs, and serve traffic over their private IP.  If the same Linode is serving traffic for more than one port on the same NodeBalancer, one NodeBalancer Node is required for each config (port) it should serve requests on.  For example, if you have four backends, and each should response to both HTTP and HTTPS requests, you will need two NodeBalancerConfigs (port 80 and port 443) and four backends each - one for each of the Linodes serving requests for that port.

id.description: This node's unique ID.

address.description: The private IP Address where this backend can be reached. This _must_ be a private IP address.

label.description: The label for this node.  This is for display purposes only.

status.description: The current status of this node, based on the configured checks of its NodeBalancer Config.

weight.description: Used when picking a backend to serve a request and is not pinned to a single backend yet.  Nodes with a higher weight will receive more traffic.

mode.description:
The mode this NodeBalancer should use when sending traffic to this backend.
* If set to `accept` this backend is accepting traffic.
* If set to `reject` this backend will not receive traffic.
* If set to `drain` this backend will not receive _new_ traffic, but connections already
  pinned to it will continue to be routed to it.

* If set to `backup`, this backend will only receive traffic if all `accept` nodes
  are down.

config_id.description: The NodeBalancer Config ID that this Node belongs to.

nodebalancer_id.description: The NodeBalancer ID that this Node belongs to.

data.description: The data returned about this NodeBalancers.

connections.description: An array of key/value pairs representing unix timestamp and reading for connections to this NodeBalancer.

in.description: An array of key/value pairs representing unix timestamp and reading for inbound traffic.

out.description: An array of key/value pairs representing unix timestamp and reading for outbound traffic.

title.description: The title for the statistics generated in this response.

Notification.description: An important, often time-sensitive item related to your Account.

id.description: The unique ID of the Notification's entity, based on the entity type.

label.description: The current label for this Notification's entity.

type.description: The type of entity this is related to.

url.description: The URL where you can access the object this Notification is for. If a relative URL, it is relative to the domain you retrieved the Notification from.

label.description: A short description of this Notification.
label.example: You have an important ticket open!

message.description: A human-readable description of the Notification.
message.example: You have an important ticket open!

body.description: A full description of this Notification, in markdown format.  Not all Notifications include bodies.

type.description: The type of Notification this is.

severity.description: The severity of this Notification.  This field can be used to decide how prominently to display the Notification, what color to make the display text, etc.

when.description: If this Notification is of an Event that will happen at a fixed, future time, this is when the named action will be taken. For example, if a Linode is to be migrated in response to a Security Advisory, this field will contain the approximate time the Linode will be taken offline for migration.

until.description: If this Notification has a duration, this will be the ending time for the Event/action. For example, if there is scheduled maintenance for one of our systems, `until` would be set to the end of the maintenance window.

OAuthClient.description: A third-party application registered to Linode that users may log into with their Linode account through our authentication server at https://login.linode.com. Using an OAuth Client, a third-party developer may be given access to some, or all, of a User's account for the purposes of their application.

id.description: The OAuth Client ID.  This is used to identify the client, and is a publicly-known value (it is not a secret).

redirect_uri.description: The location a successful log in from https://login.linode.com should be redirected to for this client. The receiver of this redirect should be ready to accept an OAuth exchange code and finish the OAuth exchange.

label.description: The name of this application.  This will be presented to users when they are asked to grant it access to their Account.

status.description: The status of this application.  `active` by default.

secret.description: The OAuth Client secret, used in the OAuth exchange.  This is returned as `<REDACTED>` except when an OAuth Client is created or its secret is reset.  This is a secret, and should not be shared or disclosed publicly.

thumbnail_url.description: The URL where this client's thumbnail may be viewed, or `null` if this client does not have a thumbnail set.

public.description: If this is a public or private OAuth Client. Public clients have a slightly different authentication workflow than private clients. See the OAuth spec for more details.

ObjectStorageBucket.description: An Object Storage Bucket. This should be accessed primarily through the S3 API; [click here for more information](https://docs.ceph.com/docs/mimic/radosgw/s3/#api).

created.description: When this bucket was created.

cluster.description: The ID of the Object Storage Cluster this bucket is in.

label.description: The name of this bucket.

hostname.description: The hostname where this bucket can be accessed. This hostname can be accessed through a browser if the bucket is made public.

size.description: The size of the bucket in bytes.

objects.description: The number of objects stored in this bucket.

ObjectStorageObject.description: An Object in Object Storage, or a "prefix" that contains one or more objects when a `delimiter` is used.

name.description: The name of this object or prefix.

etag.description: An MD-5 hash of the object. `null` if this object represents a prefix.

last_modified.description: The date and time this object was last modified. `null` if this object represents a prefix.

owner.description: The owner of this object, as a UUID. `null` if this object represents a prefix.

size.description: The size of this object, in bytes. `null` if this object represents a prefix.

next_marker.description: Returns the value you should pass to the `marker` query parameter to get the next page of objects. If there is no next page, `null` will be returned.

is_truncated.description: Designates if there is another page of bucket objects.

id.description: The unique ID for this cluster.

domain.description: The base URL for this cluster, used for connecting with third-party clients.

region.description: The region where this cluster is located.

static_site_domain.description: The base URL for this cluster used when hosting static sites.

ObjectStorageKey.description: A keypair used to communicate with the Object Storage S3 API.

id.description: This keypair's unique ID

label.description: The label given to this key. For display purposes only.

access_key.description: This keypair's access key. This is not secret.

secret_key.description: This keypair's secret key. Only returned on key creation.

limited.description: Whether or not this key is a limited access key. Will return `false` if this key grants full access to all buckets on the user's account.

bucket_access.description:
Defines this key as a Limited Access Key. Limited Access Keys restrict this Object Storage key's access to only the bucket(s) declared in this array and define their bucket-level permissions.


  Limited Access Keys can:

  * [list all buckets](/api/v4/object-storage-buckets/) available on this Account, but cannot perform any actions on a bucket unless it has access to the bucket.

  * [create new buckets](/api/v4/object-storage-buckets/#post), but do not have any access to the buckets it creates, unless explicitly given access to them.


  **Note:** You can create an Object Storage Limited Access Key without access to any buckets.
  This is achieved by sending a request with an empty `bucket_access` array.

cluster.description: The Object Storage cluster where a bucket to which the key is granting access is hosted.

bucket_name.description: The unique label of the bucket to which the key will grant limited access.

permissions.description: This Limited Access Key's permissions for the selected bucket.

ObjectStorageSSL.description: Upload a TLS/SSL certificate and private key to be served when you visit your Object Storage bucket via HTTPS.

certificate.description: Your Base64 encoded and PEM formatted SSL certificate.

private_key.description: The private key associated with this TLS/SSL certificate.

ObjectStorageSSLResponse.description: If this Object Storage bucket has a corresponding TLS/SSL Certificate.

ssl.description: A boolean indicating if this Bucket has a corresponding TLS/SSL certificate that was uploaded by an Account user.

id.description: The unique ID of the Payment.

usd.description: The amount, in US dollars, of the Payment.

cvv.description: CVV (Card Verification Value) of the credit card to be used for the Payment.

usd.description: The amount in US Dollars of the Payment. The maximum credit card payment that can be made is $50,000 dollars.

PayPal.description: An object representing the staging of a Payment via PayPal.

cancel_url.description: The URL to have PayPal redirect to when Payment is cancelled.

redirect_url.description: The URL to have PayPal redirect to when Payment is approved.

usd.description: The payment amount in USD. Minimum accepted value of $5 USD. Maximum accepted value of $500 USD or credit card payment limit; whichever value is highest. PayPal's maximum transaction limit is $10,000 USD.

PayPalExecute.description: An object representing an execution of Payment to PayPal to capture the funds and credit your Linode Account.

payer_id.description: The PayerID returned by PayPal during the transaction authorization process.

payment_id.description: The PaymentID returned from [POST /account/payments/paypal](/account-payments-paypal/#post) that has been approved with PayPal.

PersonalAccessToken.description: A Personal Access Token is a token generated manually to access the API without going through an OAuth login.  Personal Access Tokens can have scopes just like OAuth tokens do, and are commonly used to give access to command-line tools like the Linode CLI, or when writing your own integrations.

id.description: This token's unique ID, which can be used to revoke it.

scopes.description: The scopes this token was created with. These define what parts of the Account the token can be used to access. Many command-line tools, such as the Linode CLI, require tokens with access to `*`. Tokens with more restrictive scopes are generally more secure.

created.description: The date and time this token was created.

label.description: This token's label.  This is for display purposes only, but can be used to more easily track what you're using each token for.

token.description: The token used to access the API.  When the token is created, the full token is returned here.  Otherwise, only the first 16 characters are returned.

expiry.description: When this token will expire.  Personal Access Tokens cannot be renewed, so after this time the token will be completely unusable and a new token will need to be generated.  Tokens may be created with "null" as their expiry and will never expire unless revoked.

Profile.description: A Profile represents your User in our system. This is where you can change information about your User. This information is available to any OAuth Client regardless of requested scopes, and can be used to populate User information in third-party applications.

uid.description: Your unique ID in our system. This value will never change, and can safely be used to identify your User.

username.description: Your username, used for logging in to our system.

email.description: Your email address.  This address will be used for communication with Linode as necessary.

timezone.description: The timezone you prefer to see times in. This is not used by the API directly. It is provided for the benefit of clients such as the Linode Cloud Manager and other clients built on the API. All times returned by the API are in UTC.

email_notifications.description: If true, you will receive email notifications about account activity.  If false, you may still receive business-critical communications through email.

referrals.description: Information about your status in our referral program.

code.description: Your referral code.  If others use this when signing up for Linode, you will receive account credit.

url.description: Your referral url, used to direct others to sign up for Linode with your referral code.

total.description: The number of users who have signed up with your referral code.

completed.description: The number of completed signups with your referral code.

pending.description: The number of pending signups with your referral code.  You will not receive credit for these signups until they are completed.

credit.description: The amount of account credit in US Dollars issued to you through the referral program.

ip_whitelist_enabled.description:
If true, logins for your User will only be allowed from whitelisted IPs. This setting is currently deprecated, and cannot be enabled.

If you disable this setting, you will not be able to re-enable it.

lish_auth_method.description:
The authentication methods that are allowed when connecting to [the Linode Shell (Lish)](https://www.linode.com/docs/platform/manager/using-the-linode-shell-lish/).
* `keys_only` is the most secure if you intend to use Lish.
* `disabled` is recommended if you do not intend to use Lish at all.
* If this account's Cloud Manager authentication type is set to a Third-Party Authentication method, `password_keys` cannot be used as your Lish authentication method. To view this account's Cloud Manager `authentication_type` field, send a request to the [View Profile](/api/v4/profile) endpoint.

authorized_keys.description: The list of SSH Keys authorized to use Lish for your User. This value is ignored if `lish_auth_method` is "disabled."

two_factor_auth.description: If true, logins from untrusted computers will require Two Factor Authentication.  See [/profile/tfa-enable](/api/v4/profile-tfa-enable/#post) to enable Two Factor Authentication.

restricted.description: If true, your User has restrictions on what can be accessed on your Account. To get details on what entities/actions you can access/perform, see [/profile/grants](/api/v4/profile-grants).

authentication_type.description:
This account's Cloud Manager authentication type. Authentication types are chosen through
Cloud Manager and authorized when logging into your account. These authentication types are either
the user's password (in conjunction with their username), or the name of their
indentity provider such as GitHub. For example, if a user:

- Has never used Third-Party Authentication, their authentication type will be `password`.
- Is using Third-Party Authentication, their authentication type will be the name of their Identity Provider (eg. `github`).
- Has used Third-Party Authentication and has since revoked it, their authentication type will be `password`.


**Note:** This functionality may not yet be available in Cloud Manager.
See the [Cloud Manager Changelog](/changelog/cloud-manager/) for the latest updates.

Region.description: An area where Linode services are available.

id.description: The unique ID of this Region.

country.description: The country where this Region resides.

capabilities.description: A list of capabilities of this region.

ipv4.description: The IPv4 addresses for this region's DNS resolvers, separated by commas.

ipv6.description: The IPv6 addresses for this region's DNS resolvers, separated by commas.

StackScript.description: A StackScript enables you to quickly deploy a fully-configured application in an automated manner.

id.description: The unique ID of this StackScript.

username.description: The User who created the StackScript.

user_gravatar_id.description: The Gravatar ID for the User who created the StackScript.

label.description: The StackScript's label is for display purposes only.

description.example: This StackScript installs and configures MySQL

images.description: An array of Image IDs. These are the images that can be deployed with this Stackscript.

deployments_total.description: The total number of times this StackScript has been deployed.

deployments_active.description: Count of currently active, deployed Linodes created from this StackScript.

is_public.description: This determines whether other users can use your StackScript. **Once a StackScript is made public, it cannot be made private.**

created.description: The date this StackScript was created.

updated.description: The date this StackScript was last updated.

rev_note.description: This field allows you to add notes for the set of revisions made to this StackScript.

script.description: The script to execute when provisioning a new Linode with this StackScript.

user_defined_fields.description: This is a list of fields defined with a special syntax inside this StackScript that allow for supplying customized parameters during deployment. See Variables and UDFs for more information.

StatsDataAvailable.description: A collection of graph data returned for managed stats.

cpu.description: CPU usage stats from the last 24 hours.

disk.description: Disk usage stats from the last 24 hours.

swap.description: Swap usage stats from the last 24 hours.

net_in.description: Inbound network traffic stats from the last 24 hours.

net_out.description: Outbound network traffic stats from the last 24 hours.

StatsDataUnavailable.description: An array of error messages if managed stats are unavaliable.

SupportTicket.description: A Support Ticket opened on your Account.

id.description: The ID of the Support Ticket.

attachments.description: A list of filenames representing attached files associated with this Ticket.

closed.description: The date and time this Ticket was closed.

closable.description: Whether the Support Ticket may be closed.

description.description: The full details of the issue or question.
description.example: I'm having trouble setting the root password on my Linode. I tried following the instructions but something is not working and I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong. Can you please help me figure out how I can reset it?

entity.description: The entity this Ticket was opened for.

id.description: The unique ID for this Ticket's entity.

label.description: The current label of this entity.

type.description: The type of entity this is related to.

url.description: The URL where you can access the object this event is for. If a relative URL, it is relative to the domain you retrieved the entity from.

gravatar_id.description: The Gravatar ID of the User who opened this Ticket.

opened.description: The date and time this Ticket was created.

opened_by.description: The User who opened this Ticket.

status.description: The current status of this Ticket.

summary.description: The summary or title for this Ticket.
summary.example: Having trouble resetting root password on my Linode

updated.description: The date and time this Ticket was last updated.

updated_by.description: The User who last updated this Ticket.

SupportTicketReply.description: An object representing a reply to a Support Ticket.

created.description: The date and time this Ticket reply was created.

created_by.description: The User who submitted this reply.

description.description: The body of this Support Ticket reply.
description.example:
Hello,
I'm sorry to hear that you are having trouble resetting the root password of your Linode. Just to be sure, have you tried to follow the instructions in our online documentation? The link is here:
 
https://linode.com/docs/quick-answers/linode-platform/reset-the-root-password-on-your-linode/ 

If you have, please reply with any additional steps you have also taken.

Regards, Linode Support Team

from_linode.description: If set to true, this reply came from a Linode employee.

gravatar_id.description: The Gravatar ID of the User who created this reply.

id.description: The unique ID of this Support Ticket reply.

SupportTicketRequest.description:
An object representing a created Support Ticket - a question or issue and request for help from the Linode support team.
Only one of the ID attributes (`linode_id`, `domain_id`, etc.) can be set on a single Support Ticket.

description.description: The full details of the issue or question.
description.example: I'm having trouble setting the root password on my Linode. I tried following the instructions but something is not working and I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong. Can you please help me figure out how I can reset it?

domain_id.description: The ID of the Domain this ticket is regarding, if relevant.

linode_id.description: The ID of the Linode this ticket is regarding, if relevant.

longviewclient_id.description: The ID of the Longview client this ticket is regarding, if relevant.

nodebalancer_id.description: The ID of the NodeBalancer this ticket is regarding, if relevant.

summary.description: The summary or title for this SupportTicket.
summary.example: Having trouble resetting root password on my Linode

managed_issue.description:
Designates if this ticket is related to a [Managed service](https://www.linode.com/products/managed/). If `true`, the following constraints will apply:
* No ID attributes (i.e. `linode_id`, `domain_id`, etc.) should be provided with this request.
* Your account must have a [Managed service enabled](/api/v4/managed-services-service-id-enable/#post).

volume_id.description: The ID of the Volume this ticket is regarding, if relevant.

Transfer.description: An object representing your network utilization for the current month, in Gigabytes.

billable.description: The amount of your transfer pool that is billable this billing cycle.

quota.description: The amount of network usage allowed this billing cycle.

used.description: The amount of network usage you have used this billing cycle.

Tag.description: A tag that has been applied to an object on your Account. Tags are currently for organizational purposes only.

label.description: A Label used for organization of objects on your Account.

User.description: A User on your Account. Unrestricted users can log in and access information about your Account, while restricted users may only access entities or perform actions they've been granted access to.

username.description: This User's username. This is used for logging in, and may also be displayed alongside actions the User performs (for example, in Events or public StackScripts).

email.description: The email address for this User, for account management communications, and may be used for other communications as configured.

restricted.description: If true, this User must be granted access to perform actions or access entities on this Account. See [/account/users/{username}/grants](/api/v4/account-users-username-grants) for details on how to configure grants for a restricted User.

ssh_keys.description: A list of SSH Key labels added by this User. These are the keys that will be deployed if this User is included in the `authorized_users` field of a [create Linode](/api/v4/linode-instances/#post), [rebuild Linode](/api/v4/linode-instances-linode-id-rebuild/#post), or [create Disk](/api/v4/linode-instances-linode-id-disks/#post) request.

tfa_enabled.description: A boolean value indicating if the User has Two Factor Authentication (TFA) enabled. See the Create Two Factor Secret ([/profile/tfa-enable](/api/v4/profile-tfa-enable/#post)) endpoint to enable TFA.

UserDefinedField.description: A custom field defined by the User with a special syntax within a StackScript. Derived from the contents of the script.

label.description: A human-readable label for the field that will serve as the input prompt for entering the value during deployment.

example.description: An example value for the field.

oneOf.description: A list of acceptable single values for the field.

manyOf.description: A list of acceptable values for the field in any quantity, combination or order.

default.description: The default value.  If not specified, this value will be used.

TrustedDevice.description: A trusted device object represents an active Remember Me session with login.linode.com.

id.description: The unique ID for this TrustedDevice

created.description: When this Remember Me session was started.  This corresponds to the time of login with the "Remember Me" box checked.

expiry.description: When this TrustedDevice session expires.  Sessions typically last 30 days.

user_agent.description: The User Agent of the browser that created this TrustedDevice session.
user_agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_13_3) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/70.0.3538.77 Safari/537.36 Vivaldi/2.1.1337.36

last_authenticated.description: The last time this TrustedDevice was successfully used to authenticate to login.linode.com.

last_remote_addr.description: The last IP Address to successfully authenticate with this TrustedDevice.

SSHKey.description: A credential object for authenticating a User's secure shell connection to a Linode.

id.description: The unique identifier of an SSH Key object.

label.description: A label for the SSH Key.

ssh_key.description: The public SSH Key, which is used to authenticate to the root user of the Linodes you deploy.

created.description: The date this key was added.

SSHKeyRequest.description: An object consisting of a user identified name as the `label` and the generated key as the `ssh-key`.

label.description: A label for the key.

ssh_key.description: The public SSH Key, which is used to authenticate to the root user of the Linodes you deploy.

Volume.description: A Block Storage Volume associated with your Account.

id.description: The unique ID of this Volume.

label.description: The Volume's label is for display purposes only.

filesystem_path.description: The full filesystem path for the Volume based on the Volume's label. Path is /dev/disk/by-id/scsi-0Linode_Volume_ + Volume label.

status.description:
The current status of the volume.  Can be one of:

  * `creating` - the Volume is being created and is not yet available
    for use.
  * `active` - the Volume is online and available for use.
  * `resizing` - the Volume is in the process of upgrading
    its current capacity.
  * `contact_support` - there is a problem with your Volume. Please
    [open a Support Ticket](/api/v4/support-tickets/#post) to resolve the issue.

linode_id.description: If a Volume is attached to a specific Linode, the ID of that Linode will be displayed here.

linode_label.description: If a Volume is attached to a specific Linode, the label of that Linode will be displayed here.

created.description: When this Volume was created.

updated.description: When this Volume was last updated.

tags.description: An array of Tags applied to this object.  Tags are for organizational purposes only.

tags.name: Account
tags.description: Use the Account endpoints to manage user settings, billing, and payments. You can also initiate and maintain OAuth client application authentication, enable the Linode Managed service, and create new users on your account.

tags.name: Domains
tags.description: Use the Domains endpoints to create and manage domains and domain records on your account.

tags.name: Images
tags.description: Use the Images endpoints to capture, store, and manage custom Linode images.

tags.name: Linode Instances
tags.description: Use the Linode Instances endpoints to create, configure, and manage your Linode instances. You can also manage the Linode Backup service; maintain and manage configuration profiles; create and maintain disks, intiate a host migration; view Linode Instance statistics; and more.

tags.name: Linode Types
tags.description: Use the Linode Types endpoints to retrieve information about Linode plan types, including pricing information, hardware resources, and network transfer allotment.

tags.name: Linode Kubernetes Engine (LKE)
tags.description: Linode Kubernetes Engine (LKE) is Linodes managed Kubernetes service. Use the LKE endpoints to create and manage Kubernetes clusters and their associated Node Pools.

tags.name: Longview
tags.description: Longview is Linodes system-level monitoring and graphing service. Use the Longview endpoints to manage your Longview subscription and plan and to create and maintain Longview clients.

tags.name: Managed
tags.description: Managed is Linodes incident response service. Use the Managed endpoints to register a service to be monitored by the Managed Service team, provide secure access to your managed services,  view information about detected issues, and more.

tags.name: Networking
tags.description: Use the Networking endpoints to view all IP addresses on your account, reorganize assigned IPv4 addresses, update RDNS, and configure IP sharing.

tags.name: NodeBalancers
tags.description: NodeBalancers is Linodes load balancing service. Use the NodeBalancers endpoints to create and manage NodeBalancers. You can also create and maintain configurations; create and maintain nodes, and view statistics.

tags.name: Object Storage
tags.description: Object Storage is Linodes S3-compatible data storage service. Use the Object Storage endpoints to create and maintaining buckets, add and remove objects from buckets, create and maintain Object Storage keys, and cancel the Object Storage service.

tags.name: Profile
tags.description: Use the Profile endpoints to manage your Linode user profile preferences and security settings. This includes creating and maintaining personal access tokens, creating and maintaining SSH keys, confirming and enabling two-factor authentication, and updating user and profile preferences.

tags.name: Regions
tags.description: Use the Regions endpoints to view information about the various Linode data center regions, including the service capabilities for each region, country, status, and more.

tags.name: StackScripts
tags.description: Linode StackScripts allow you to create reusable scripts to configure new Linode instances. Use the StackScripts endpoints to create and manage StackScripts on your account.

tags.name: Support
tags.description: Use the Support endpoints to open, view, and close Linode Support tickets. You can also create and manage your Support ticket replies.

tags.name: Tags
tags.description: Tags allow you to organize and group your various Linode services. Use the Tags endpoints to create, assign, and delete your account tags.

tags.name: Volumes
tags.description: Volumes is Linodes block storage service. Use the Volumes endpoints to create, attach, and manage your account Volumes.
